text: Yeah it's a bit of a catch 22, unfortunately. I just try to resolve all the grammatical errors and it tends to fix the issue.
Hi. Can we combine Advanced Google Search and HubSpot’s new Search Results module? <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/google-advanced-search-tips>
is there any way to globally disable HubSpot's image compression in emails?/ Having to repeatedly add the `?noresize` to src urls is a real PITA
I haven’t but I am going to be attempting something very similar soon.  Any tips you have would be awesome

My best tip: avoid doing this until HS releases their front end accounts type feature(forget what they called it)
If you’re client can’t wait, quote crazy high. You’re going to have to do a lot of wizardry in a territory where most HS devs haven’t gone.

We feel our login system works great and is sufficiently secure for our clients needs, our only problem is we still don’t have a solution for making flex column content secure. We have work-arounds to using a flex column mulling in the back of our heads but they’re not ideal

I'm not sure there's a way to combine - but would love to hear if other's have ideas.

Although not exactly what you asked, you do have some flexibility in customizing the search results... maybe this will help get you closer to the solution you're looking to build: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/How-do-you-customize-the-quot-Search-Module-quot-results-editing/td-p/199446>
Anyone else having problems in the CTA tool? Just got this:

Can you define ‘promptly’? What is the expected length of time? x number of seconds, x number of minutes?

So that we are not reporting unnecessarily

don’t like the new simplified triangle based UI? cmon, it’s the next trend after brutalist web design.

lol looks like a stylesheet failed to load try hard refreshing
yeah we quoted pretty high, good to know HubSpot is working on something though.
Yea, they talked about it at Inbound, but they were super vague in describing how it will work.
lol of course
Looks fine to me
lol this is why i like to include width/height attributes on my inline SVGs :laughing:
Same basic idea, and you could use the same table, just rather than using that loop to populate a table, use it to render a block of HTML, similar to a blog listing page.
And you could ditch the js framework and just render everything in hubl
"don’t like the new simplified triangle based UI?" .... just LOLed hard. :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing::rolling_on_the_floor_laughing::rolling_on_the_floor_laughing::rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
LMK if it's not fixed in a few minutes... I'll hunt around to see what's up
On refresh it went back to normal, but I've noticed that a few times when I'm redirected from the old tool to the beta I get some weird rendering issues
sounds like a user error to me :wink:

sounds like a you discovered a feature, not a :bug:

:laughing:
Currently no, but we’re interested in seeing examples of images that were not compressed well and we’re actively working on a higher quality resizer.
should be <1 min
I hate decaterpillaring my code

<@U22PJPGK0> thanks. our concerns are essentially around logos. we want them to be as sharp as possible, and typically use a 2x version for retina devices. for those we want zero compression, so we've been throwing the `noresize` on there
ok. Examples would still be useful. We use them to evaluate new algorithms.
IS anyone having caching issues?
sorry not lately.
I've updated a page and updated the css file for the portal, also cleared my cache through inspector and nothing is updating, however, the cachebuster param works
im wondering if the site not updating is due to the fact that they are 3 months over their billed date... :thinking_face:
I am actually experiencing something similar right now. you try republishing the page or template where the CSS file appears? I think that's going to for me at least
hrmmm interesting, let me try
And related to the above triangle UI, just had a minor heart attack when the beta DM wouldn't load and redirected me to 1.0... hoping this is just something going on with HS servers
updating main template didnt help :disappointed:

i had an issue yesterday where I updated code to a coded file and then had to go into the pages that were using that coded file and update them to make changes was really weird since you would think updating to coded file would be all you need to do in that instance
anyone ever built a pdf generator on HubSpot?  specifically, a link that you can click that will spit out a pdf of the content on the page and has a different layout than the page
i found a coupld javascript libraries, but before i dig in, thought i would ask
Not quite ive built a PDF renderer for a basic PWA built on HS. But it didnt generate a pdf. Only rendered its contents and let you page through it
<https://mozilla.github.io/pdf.js/> ?
Can confirm, have used pdf.js
this is exactly what I used for my project, it was amazing.

OK - quick learning lesson - Disregard my (at)here message I sent a few minutes ago about the chat bot. I’m not sure it’s going to work for us ... trying to figure out if I can configure it for our needs. But in the meantime, I turned it off. Thanks for your patience my friends. :pray:
